turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Tactical!

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: Inoperative.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Raise the shields...

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: Yours... is... the superior...

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: I shall avenge you --

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: You still remember, Admiral. I cannot help but be touched. Of course, I remember you.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What is the meaning of this attack? Where is the crew of the Reliant?

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Surely I have made my meaning plain. I mean to avenge myself upon you, Admiral. I've deprived your ship of power and when I swing round I mean to deprive you of your life --

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: -- But I wanted you to know first who it was who had beaten you: I, Khan Noonian Singh, the eagle you attempted to cage forever.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Khan, listen to me -- if its me you want, I'll have myself beamed aboard. All I ask is that you spare my crew.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: That is a most intriguing offer. Typical, I must say of your sterling character. Let me think.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Genesis, what's that?

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Don't play with me, Kirk, my hand is on the phaser control --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Give me some time to recall the data on our computers --

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: I give you sixty seconds, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Thirty seconds...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: ... to prevent an enemy from doing just what we're attempting; using <u>our</u> console to tap in a message, an order to lower Reliant's damn shields...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Khan, how do I know you'll keep your word?

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: I've given you no word to keep, Admiral. In my judgment, you simply have no alternative.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I take your point. Stand by to receive our transmission.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Time's up, Admiral...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Here it comes. Now, Spock.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Kirk! Kirk, you are still alive -- my old friend...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Still, 'old friend.' You've managed to kill just about everyone else, but like a poor marksman, you keep missing the target.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Perhaps I no longer need to try.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Goodbye, Admiral. Oh, and don't count on Enterprise. She can't move. My next act will be to blow her out of the heavens.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: KHAN!

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: I don't know you. But you. I never forget a face. Mister Chekov, isn't it?  I never thought to see your face again.

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: Chekov, who is this man?

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: You are in a position to demand nothing, sir. I, on the other hand, am in a position to grant nothing. What you see is all that remains of the ship's company and the crew of the <u>Botany Bay</u>, marooned here fifteen years ago by Captain James T. Kirk.

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: Listen to me -- you men and women --

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Save your strength, Captain, these people have sworn to live and die at my command two hundred years before you were born. Do you mean he...  ... never told you the tale? To amuse you, Captain? Never told you how the <u>Enterprise</u> picked up the <u>Botany Bay</u>, lost in space from the year 1996, myself and the ship's company in cryogenic freeze?

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: I've never even met Admiral Kirk --

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Admiral? He didn't tell you how <u>Admiral</u> Kirk sent seventy of us into exile on this barren sand heap with only the contents of these cargo bays to sustain us?

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Captain... We're waiting. What's the delay?

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: All is well, sir. You have the coordinates to beam up Genesis...

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: First things first, Captain. Kill Admiral Kirk.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: An emergency situation has arisen. By order of Starfleet Command, as of now, 1800 hours, I am assuming command of this vessel. Duty officer so note in the ship's log. Plot a new course: for Space Laboratory Regula I.  Mr. Scott?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY'S VOICE
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We'll be going to warp speed --

turns.speaker: SCOTTY'S VOICE
turns.text: Aye, sir --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Scotty -- what's left?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY'S VOICE
turns.text: Just the batteries, sir. I can have auxiliary power in a few minutes --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We don't have minutes. Can you give me phaser power?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY'S VOICE
turns.text: A few shots, sir.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY'S VOICE
turns.text: Just barely, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm going down to the station.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY'S VOICE
turns.text: I'll need ten minutes, sir, 'til the radiation dissipates.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura, send to Commander, Reliant: prepare to be boarded.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura. Can't you augment?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: I'm trying, sir. Stand by...

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: She's not responding...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Try the emergency channels...

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Enterprise to Reliant. Come in, Reliant.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Picture, Mr. Saavik.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: I'm getting a voice message... wait ... short range band. They say their Chambers coil is shorting their COMM system.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Mr. Scott on discrete.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Scotty, let's have it.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: On screen.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Admiral --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Do it, while we have time.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: ... No response, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Sensors, Captain?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Saavik, for God's sake, tell her we're all right.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: I say again. This is Enterprise. Please acknowledge signal. Please --

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Enterprise to Reliant: you are ordered to surrender your vessel. Respond!  Nothing, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We'll beam aboard. Alert transporter room --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott, you old space dog. You're well?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I had me a wee bout -- but Dr. McCoy pulled me through.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Oh? A wee bout of what, Mr. Scott?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Midshipman, you're a tiger.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: My sister's youngest, Admiral. Crazy to get to space.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Every young boy's fancy. I seem to remember it myself.  Very well. Mr. Scott, are your engines capable of handling a minor training cruise?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Give the word, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott, the word is given.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: <u>WHY</u>?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: He wants to kill me for passing sentence on him 14 years ago -- and he doesn't care who stands between him and his vengeance.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: The energizer's bypassed like a Christmas tree -- so don't give me too many bumps.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No promises, Mr. Scott. On your way.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Admiral, I've got to take the mains off the line. The energizer's shaken loose and I can't get in there to fix her -- radiation --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: All right, we'll do the job with auxiliary power.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: No, sir! You'll flood the whole compartment...!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: He'll die -- !

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: If he hadn't, we'd be space by now.

turns.speaker: SPOCK'S VOICE
turns.text: Admiral, this is Spock.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes, Spock.

turns.speaker: SPOCK'S VOICE
turns.text: Engine room reports auxiliary power restored. We can proceed at impulse power.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Best speed to Regula I. Kirk out. Scotty, I've got to ask: Any chance of getting the mains back on the line?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Kirk to Enterprise. Damage report, Spock?

turns.speaker: SPOCK'S VOICE
turns.text: Admiral, if we go by the book, like Lieutenant Saavik, hours could seem like days.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I read you, Captain. Let's have it.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Meaning you can't even beam us back?

turns.speaker: SPOCK'S VOICE
turns.text: Not at present.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock, this is Kirk. It's two hours. Are you about ready?

turns.speaker: SPOCK'S VOICE
turns.text: Right on schedule, Admiral. Just give us your coordinates and we'll beam you aboard.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: And who is this?

turns.speaker: PRESTON
turns.text: Midshipman First Class Peter Preston, engineers mate, SIR.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Your first training voyage, Mr. Preston?

turns.speaker: PRESTON
turns.text: Yes, SIR.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I see. Well, shall we start with the engine room?

turns.speaker: PRESTON
turns.text: I believe you'll find everything shipshape, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Oh do you? Have you any idea, Midshipman Preston, how many times I've had to listen to Mr. Scott on the Comm, telling me his troubles? Have you any idea the ribbing I've had to endure in the officers' mess to the effect that the Enterprise is a flying death trap?

turns.speaker: PRESTON
turns.text: Oh, no, sir! This is the finest engine room in the whole Star --

turns.speaker: PRESTON
turns.text: Is the word given?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The word is given: warp speed.

turns.speaker: PRESTON
turns.text: Aye...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I assume you are loitering here to learn what efficiency rating I plan to give your cadets.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I am understandably curious.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: They destroyed the simulator room and you with it.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The <u>Kobayshi Maru</u> scenario frequently wreaks havoc with students and equipment.  As I recall you took the test three times yourself. Your final solution was, shall we say, unique?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It had the virtue of never having been tried.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Yours was not a solution which would have occurred to a Vulcan mentality.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: So you said at the time. Speaking of which, your protg's first rare -- a trifle emotional --

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: She's half Romulan, Jim. The admixture makes her more volatile than -- me, for example.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Than you. Yes, I see that. By the way, thank you for this.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I know of your fondness for antiques.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times...' Message, Spock?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: None of which I am consciously aware -- except, of course, happy birthday -- surely the best of times.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Hrummm... and where are you off to, now?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The Enterprise. I must check in before your inspection. And you?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Home.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Permission to come aboard, Captain?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Welcome aboard, Admiral. I believe you know my trainee crew. Certainly they have come to know you.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes, we've been through death and life together.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: There's a first time for everything, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: To be sure, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Something may be wrong at Regula I. We've been ordered to investigate.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Regula I is a scientific research laboratory, if memory serves...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I told Starfleet all we had was a boatload of children but we're the only ship in the quadrant. Spock: those cadets of yours -- how good are they? How will they respond under real pressure?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Like all living beings, Admiral each according to his gifts. The ship is yours.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That won't be necessary: just take me to Regula I.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Excuse my presumption, but I do not agree. As a teacher on a training mission, I am content to command a Starship. If we are to go on actual duty, it is clear that the senior officer aboard must assume command.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But it may be nothing; garbled communications. Why don't you...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: You proceed from a false assumption. I am a Vulcan. I have no ego to bruise.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You are going to remind me that logic alone dictates your actions.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I was going to remind you of nothing, least of all that which you know well.  Your mistake, if I may be so bold, was promotion. Commanding a Starship is your first best destiny. Anything else is a waste of material.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I would not presume to debate you.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: That is wise. In any case, were I to invoke logic, logic clearly dictates that the needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Or the one.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Will you accompany me to the bridge?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I'd best talk with Mr. Scott, first so that he may, in his own words, explain the situation to his cadets.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: There are two possibilities, sir they are unwilling to respond, they are unable to respond.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: How far?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Twelve hours and forty-three minutes, present speed.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Give up Genesis, she said. What in God's name does that mean? Give it up to whom?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It might help my analysis if I knew what Genesis was.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Carol Marcus --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It literally is Genesis...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The power of creation --

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Have they proceeded with their experiments?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The tape was made a year ago. I can only assume they've reached Phase Two by now --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Gentlemen, this isn't --

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Really, Dr. McCoy; you cannot ban the acquisition of knowledge because you distrust the moral implications of what you learn. Logic suggests --

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: What's she doing here?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Chekov's on Reliant, isn't he?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Is it possible their COMM system has failed -- ?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It would explain a great many things --

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Their coil emissions are normal... Wait: their shields are going up. They're locking phasers -- !

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Raise shields! Energize phasers, stand by to --

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: They knew just where to hit us.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: WHO? Who knew just where to hit us? And <u>why</u>?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: One thing is certain; we cannot escape on auxiliary power.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Visual!  Mr. Sulu, divert everything to the phasers --

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Too late --

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Not enough against their shields.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Who the <u>hell</u> are they?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Admiral, you can't give him Genesis...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: At least we know he hasn't got it. Just keep nodding as though I'm giving orders. Saavik, punch up the data charts of Reliant's command console -- hurry...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The prefix code?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It's all we've got.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You've got to learn WHY things work on a Starship.  It's coming through now, Khan...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The prefix code is 16309. All commands from each Starship bridge are relayed electronically; each ship has its own prefix combination code...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Let's hope he hasn't changed the combination. He's quite intelligent...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Wait for my signal, Spock -- too soon and he'll have time to figure it out and raise them again.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Scanners and sensors still inoperative. There's no way to tell what's  inside the station.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: And no way of knowing if Reliant is still in the area...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Affirmative, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: ... Blind as a Tiberian Bat. What do you make of the plantoid beyond?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Regula is class "D'. It consists of various remarkable ores. Essentially, a great rock in space.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Reliant could be hiding behind that rock.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: A distinct possibility.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Engine room... Scotty, do we have enough power for the transporters?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: All right, join the party. Mr. Spock, the ship is yours.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Aye sir --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Establish a parking orbit around the station and send me a complete damage report when you've talked with Mr. Scott.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Be careful, Jim...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What IS working around here?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Not much, Admiral. We have partial main power...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That's it?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Best we could do in two hours.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uh oh.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: She can out-run us and out-gun us. But there is the Mutara Nebula at 153 mark four.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Scotty, can we make it inside?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I think we can guarantee she'll follow us, Mr. Saavik. Remind me to explain to you the concept of human ego.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Best speed, Scotty...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Estimating nebula penetration in two minutes. Reliant is closing.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Steady as you go...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Admiral, they're reducing speed.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura, patch me in --

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Sporadic energy readings port side, aft. Could be an impulse turn.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: He won't break off now. If he followed me this far he'll be back. But from where...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: He's intelligent, but not experienced. His pattern indicates two dimensional thinking...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The ship -- out of danger?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: ... the good of the few...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Or the one.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I never took the <u>Kobayashi Maru</u> test -- until now. What do you think of my solution?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock...!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I have been -- and always will be -- your friend... Live. Long. And. Prosper.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Kirk here.

turns.speaker: UHURA'S VOICE
turns.text: I have an urgent CommPic from Space Lab Regula I for the Admiral. Dr. Carol Marcus.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: In my quarters, Uhura.

turns.speaker: UHURA'S VOICE
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura! What's happening? Damn it...

turns.speaker: UHURA'S VOICE
turns.text: Transmission jammed at the source, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Damn. Alert Starfleet Headquarters. I want to talk with Starfleet Command.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Captain Spock, if you do not hear from us within <u>one hour</u> your orders are to restore what power you can, take the Enterprise to the nearest Star Base and alert Starfleet command when you are out of jamming range.

turns.speaker: UHURA'S VOICE
turns.text: Sir -- we won't leave you behind...!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura, if you don't hear from us, there won't be anybody behind. Kirk out.  You gentleman can remain here, or...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Any suggestions, Admiral?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Prayer, Mr. Saavik. The Klingons do not take prisoners.  Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Well, Mr. Saavik, are you going to stay with the sinking ship?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Permission to speak candidly, sir?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Very well.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: I don't believe this was a fair test of my command capabilities.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: And why not?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Because... there was no way to win.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: A no-win situation is a possibility every commander may face. Has that never occurred to you?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: ... No, sir. It has not.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: How we deal with death is at least as important as how we deal with life, wouldn't you say?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: As I indicated, Admiral, that thought had not occurred to me.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Then you have something new to think about. Carry on.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Lieutenant, are you wearing your hair differently?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: It is still regulation, Admiral.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: May I speak, sir?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Lieutenant, self-expression does not seem to be one of your problems.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: I wish to thank you for the high efficiency rating.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You earned it.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: I did not think so.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You're bothered by your performance on the <u>Kobayashi Maru</u>.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: I failed to resolve the situation.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: There is no correct resolution. It is a test of character.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: May I ask how <u>you</u> dealt with the test?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You may ask, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That was a little joke.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Humor... that is a difficult concept ... it is not logical...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We learn by doing, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Take the test again.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: This is damned peculiar.  Yellow alert.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Energize defense fields.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Khan!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Reliant's command...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: HURRY.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: On screen...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We're finding it.  Please, <u>please</u> -- you've got to give us time -- the bridge is smashed, computers inoperative...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Begging the Admiral's pardon: General Order 15: 'No  flag officer shall beam into a hazardous area without armed escort.'

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: There is no such regulation.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Indeterminate life signs.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Phasers on stun. Move out.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: That's true, Admiral. All the memory cells have been emptied.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Erased...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: It doesn't make sense. These coordinates are well within Regula -- a plantoid we know to be lifeless and airless.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: If Stage Two was completed, it was underground -- she said it was going to be underground.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Stage Two of what?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Admiral?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: As your teacher Mr. Spock is fond of saying: I like to think there always are possibilities.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What's on your mind, Lieutenant?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: The <u>Kobayashi Maru</u>, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Are you asking me if we are playing out that scenario now, Lieutenant?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: On the test, sir, will you tell me what you did? I'd really like to know.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I reprogrammed the simulation so it was possible to rescue the ship.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: <u>WHAT</u>?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I changed the conditions of the test. I received a commendation for original thinking.  I don't like to lose.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Then -- you never faced that situation -- faced death...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: But the damage report -- we were immobilized...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Come, come, Lieutenant, you of all people go by the book. Hello, Spock. You remember Dr. Marcus...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Regulation 46-A: 'If transmissions are being monitored during battle...'

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: '... no uncoded messages on an open channel...'

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: That was close --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: They just don't want us going in there.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Hold your course. Look sharp...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: At what.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Saavik, all stop.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: All stop, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Descend ten thousand meters. Stand by photon torpedoes.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Cease fire. Look sharp.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Power levels quite low, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott, can you get the mains back on line?
